intro: Lysinema pungens var. album, commonly known as the white-flowered false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and showy white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, berry-like fruits that contain toxic seeds, making it potentially harmful to livestock and humans. It thrives in moist, shady woodland environments and is often found in rich, loamy soils. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle this plant with care.
